text: Tangut (Tangut: ; ) is a Sino-Tibetan language. It is an extinct language. It was spoken by the Tangut people. It was an official language of the Western Xia dynasty. The language is written with the Tangut script. In 1908, Pyotr Kozlov and his expedition team reached Khara-Khoto. They found Tangut texts in a pagoda. They took the manuscript back to Russia. == References == Category:Sino-Tibetan languages Category:Extinct languages
title: Tangut language
